Name: Lusaka
Description: Lusaka, in Lusaka Province, is the capital of Zambia. It is a cosmopolitan city that is home to approximately one in ten Zambians.

Name: Chingola
Description: Chingola is a city of 157,000 in Zambia. It lies in the Copperbelt region, the country's main copper mining area and its economy relies heavily on mining activities. In fact, the town was established in 1943, when the large copper mines of nearby Nchanga were opened.

Name: Chipata
Description: Chipata is a small and dusty crossroads in Eastern Zambia, and is a popular refueling station for overlanders on their way east to Malawi, west to South Luangwa National Park, or north to Lundazi.

Name: Kabwe
Description: Kabwe is a city in Central Zambia. It is the capital of Central Province.

Name: Kitwe
Description: Kitwe is large town in Northern Zambia, in the Copperbelt region.

Name: Livingstone
Description: Livingstone is to Zambia what the town of Victoria Falls is to Zimbabwe.  Formerly known as Maramba, it was once the capital of Zambia before it was moved to Lusaka.  Livingstone is in the Southern Province of Zambia and is the Tourist capital of the country.

Name: Ndola
Description: Ndola is in the Copperbelt in Zambia

Name: Kafue National Park
Description: Kafue National Park is in the Kafue River Basin of Zambia. It is approx. 22,400 kmÂ² and is one of the largest parks in the country and the world. Its geography varies considerably from flood plains in the north to desert regions in the south.

Name: Lower Zambezi National Park
Description: Lower Zambezi National Park is in Zambia.

Name: North Luangwa National Park
Description: North Luangwa National Park is a national park in Eastern Zambia, a short flight away from South Luangwa National Park.  It was until 2005  the domain of a limited number of safari operators who held a government concession. Since 2005, day visitors have been allowed.

Name: South Luangwa National Park
Description: South Luangwa National Park is in eastern Zambia.

Name: Victoria Falls
Description: Victoria Falls is a town in the western portion of Zimbabwe, across the border from Livingstone, Zambia, and near Botswana. The town lies immediately next to the falls, and they are the major attraction, but this popular tourist destination offers both adventure seekers and sightseers plenty of opportunities for a longer stay.
